I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, & returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $72 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing & they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $228 for service at an address I haven't lived at since April! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

Switched to Frontier Fiber 10 months ago and very happy with the decision. Previous provider (Comcast) was unreliable with constant outages. Work from home daily with video calls and large file transfers, no issues at all. Price is $68/month which is reasonable for the speed. Installation was professional and on time. The tech explained everything and made sure I was satisfied before leaving. Customer service the one time I called was helpful and knowledgeable. Only minor complaint is the router could have better range, but it works fine for my needs. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for fiber internet.

Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 14 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $54/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $93/month - over a 116% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $15/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $19/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $12/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $11 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 82 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 54% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 26 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 4 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $254 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Best Decision for Internet

review_text: After years of struggling with Cox's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $53/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $123 I was paying Cox for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 3 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $53 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 14 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $42/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $114/month - over a 85% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $14/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $24/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $9/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $10 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 66 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 69% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 28 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 6 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $358 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Save Your Money - Go Elsewhere

review_text: After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Austin, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 100 Mbps plan for $58/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $109 I was paying Xfinity for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 7 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $58 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

title: Exceeded Expectations

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $94 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $234 for service at an address I haven't lived at since April! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: Regret Switching to Frontier

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 8 months ago after their sales rep promised me 200 Mbps fiber for just $39/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $122/month - over a 138% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $10/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $24/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $14/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $25 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 79 Mbps on average instead of the promised 200 Mbps. That's only 52% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 45 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 8 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $387 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

Had Frontier for 15 months in Dallas and it's been excellent. The 1000 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $89/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 2000 sq ft home. Coming from Cox where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.
title: Fiber Changed Everything

review_text: Worst customer service ever. Spent hours on hold just to get nowhere. Still have the same problem after 3 weeks.
title: Hidden Fees Everywhere

review_text: After years of struggling with Cox's unreliable cable internet here in San Diego, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 500 Mbps plan for $74/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $108 I was paying Cox for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 5 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 500 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $74 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

I went with their 500 Mbps plan for $52/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $130 I was paying Cox for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 10 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 500 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $52 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

title: Nightmare Experience

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $81 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $288 for service at an address I haven't lived at since March! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 16 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $44/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $118/month - over a 143% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $12/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $19/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $11/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $19 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 92 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 65% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 38 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 5 times over the past 2 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $282 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $273 for service at an address I haven't lived at since July! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $64 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 17 months ago after their sales rep promised me 200 Mbps fiber for just $52/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $109/month - over a 142% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $12/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $24/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $14/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $13 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 78 Mbps on average instead of the promised 200 Mbps. That's only 52% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 29 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 5 times over the past 2 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $260 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

After years of struggling with Spectrum's unreliable cable internet here in San Diego, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 8 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $52 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Spectrum's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $106 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $247 for service at an address I haven't lived at since June! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: Billing Nightmare

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 11 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $36/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $117/month - over a 94% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $12/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $18/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $11/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $10 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 39 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 59% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 36 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 4 times over the past 8 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $300 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Excellent Fiber Internet

review_text: After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Dallas, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 1000 Mbps plan for $82/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $123 I was paying Xfinity for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 6 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 1000 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $82 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

Customer service was rude and unhelpful. Service itself is okay when it works but I've had 6 outages in the last three months. Each time I call they promise a credit that never appears on my bill. The whole experience feels scammy. Contract ends in 8 months and I'll be switching immediately. Check all the fees before signing up or you'll get burned like I did.
title: Billing Nightmare

review_text: Installation was quick and professional. Service has been rock solid. Best ISP I've had.
Terrible service.. Internet goes down all the time. Called support multiple times, they never fix anything. Looking to switch ASAP.

Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 17 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $47/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $92/month - over a 114% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $15/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $22/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $10/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $10 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 85 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 67% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 29 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 5 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $287 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

Installation was supposed to happen Monday. Technician never showed, never called. Rescheduled for the next week, tech arrived 2 hours late. Install took 3 hours and left cables running across my ceiling in the ugliest way possible. Asked about running them through walls, was told that costs extra. The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 2500 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $141. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them a year and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.

Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.

This makes working from home nearly impossible during peak hours. Customer service is terrible - I've called 8 times about the speed issues and each time they run diagnostics, say everything looks fine, and nothing changes. The last technician admitted the area is oversold but said there's nothing they can do. On top of that, my promotional rate ended and the bill jumped from $41 to $125 per month with no warning. Trying to negotiate got me nowhere. Really disappointed and actively looking at other providers. Would not recommend Frontier.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $78 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $321 for service at an address I haven't lived at since May! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: 5 Stars - Would Recommend

review_text: After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Dallas, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $52/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $126 I was paying Xfinity for only 50 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 11 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $52 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.
title: Smooth Experience

Work from home daily with video calls and large file transfers, no issues at all. Price is $59/month which is reasonable for the speed. Installation was professional and on time. The tech explained everything and made sure I was satisfied before leaving. Customer service the one time I called was helpful and knowledgeable. Only minor complaint is the router could have better range, but it works fine for my needs. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for fiber internet.

Customer service is terrible - I've called 8 times about the speed issues and each time they run diagnostics, say everything looks fine, and nothing changes. The last technician admitted the area is oversold but said there's nothing they can do. On top of that, my promotional rate ended and the bill jumped from $47 to $125 per month with no warning. Trying to negotiate got me nowhere. Really disappointed and actively looking at other providers. Would not recommend Frontier.

title: Worst ISP Experience Ever

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $86 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $183 for service at an address I haven't lived at since April! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.
title: Cancellation Process is Impossible

review_text: Installation took 3 visits and service still doesn't work properly. Completely unprofessional.

Had Frontier for 16 months in San Antonio and it's been excellent. The 500 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $84/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 1500 sq ft home. Coming from Xfinity where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.
title: Could Be Better

review_text: After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in San Diego, switching 2 Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household.. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 1000 Mbps plan for $58/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $129 I was paying Comcast for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 14 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 1000 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $58 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

Installation was supposed to happen Monday. Technician never showed, never called. Rescheduled for the next week, tech arrived 5 hours late. Install took 6 hours and left cables running across my ceiling in the ugliest way possible. Asked about running them through walls, was told that costs extra. The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 2500 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $140. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 18 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.
title: Hidden Fees Everywhere

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 14 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $35/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $102/month - over a 138% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $14/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $25/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $10/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $12 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 64 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 49% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 34 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 6 times over the past 4 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $310 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 13 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $42/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $109/month - over a 135% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $13/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $19/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $15/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $24 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 93 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 52% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 15 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 8 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $319 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Still Waiting for Resolution

review_text: Finally have reliable internet in my area. Speeds are exactly as advertised. Very happy with the switch.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $80 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $313 for service at an address I haven't lived at since June! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: Terrible Service

review_text: Installation was quick and professional. Service has been rock solid. Best ISP I've had.

After years of struggling with AT&T's unreliable cable internet here in San Diego, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $53/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $115 I was paying AT&T for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 6 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $53 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with AT&T's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $60 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 9 times over the past 6 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $229 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Good Internet, Poor Support

review_text: After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in Austin, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 500 Mbps plan for $51/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $120 I was paying Comcast for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 15 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 500 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $51 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

review_text: Had Frontier for 17 months in Austin and it's been excellent. The 100 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $62/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 1800 sq ft home. Coming from Spectrum where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.

After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Austin, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 100 Mbps plan for $56/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $97 I was paying Xfinity for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 7 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $56 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 9 months ago after their sales rep promised me 1000 Mbps fiber for just $39/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $110/month - over a 135% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $11/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $20/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $12/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $22 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 54 Mbps on average instead of the promised 1000 Mbps. That's only 35% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 37 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 4 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $201 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Finally Reliable Internet

review_text: After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 500 Mbps plan for $55/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $95 I was paying Comcast for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 13 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 500 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $55 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.
