review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $107 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $245 for service at an address I haven't lived at since July! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them a year and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.
Bill keeps going up every month. Hidden fees everywhere. Not what was advertised at all.

Had Frontier for 15 months in Los Angeles and it's been excellent. The 500 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $82/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 1500 sq ft home. Coming from AT&T where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.

I've been dealing with Frontier for 10 months now and it's been frustrating. The speeds are inconsistent - sometimes close to the advertised 500 Mbps, other times dropping to 19 Mbps. This makes working from home nearly impossible during peak hours. Customer service is terrible - I've called 6 times about the speed issues and each time they run diagnostics, say everything looks fine, and nothing changes. The last technician admitted the area is oversold but said there's nothing they can do. On top of that, my promotional rate ended and the bill jumped from $30 to $96 per month with no warning. Trying to negotiate got me nowhere. Really disappointed and actively looking at other providers. Would not recommend Frontier.

title: Acceptable Service

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 18 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $41/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $125/month - over a 127% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $11/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $22/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $8/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $25 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 40 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 55% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 40 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 6 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $334 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Price Doubled After Promo

review_text: Fiber is amazing! No more buffering. Work from home is so much easier now. 5 stars.

After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in Los Angeles, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 1000 Mbps plan for $62/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $101 I was paying Comcast for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 8 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 1000 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $62 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

title: Great Service!

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $87 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $314 for service at an address I haven't lived at since March! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: False Advertising - Speeds Not as Promised

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $66 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $253 for service at an address I haven't lived at since May! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 10 months ago after their sales rep promised me 1000 Mbps fiber for just $43/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $104/month - over a 138% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $13/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $23/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $11/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $20 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 87 Mbps on average instead of the promised 1000 Mbps. That's only 69% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 19 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 8 times over the past 4 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $339 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 100 Mbps plan for $70/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $122 I was paying Xfinity for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 12 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $70 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

Would give zero stars if I could.

Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $66 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

title: Smooth Experience

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 7 months ago after their sales rep promised me 200 Mbps fiber for just $54/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $112/month - over a 90% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $14/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $24/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $8/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $21 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 69 Mbps on average instead of the promised 200 Mbps. That's only 66% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 37 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 9 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $363 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $74 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $247 for service at an address I haven't lived at since July! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.
Installation was quick and professional. Service has been rock solid. Best ISP I've had.

After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in San Antonio, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 500 Mbps plan for $68/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $122 I was paying Comcast for only 50 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 12 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 500 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $68 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

This makes working from home nearly impossible during peak hours. Customer service is terrible - I've called 3 times about the speed issues and each time they run diagnostics, say everything looks fine, and nothing changes. The last technician admitted the area is oversold but said there's nothing they can do. On top of that, my promotional rate ended and the bill jumped from $45 to $123 per month with no warning. Trying to negotiate got me nowhere. Really disappointed and actively looking at other providers. Would not recommend Frontier.

Had Frontier for 3 months in Dallas and it's been excellent. The 200 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $67/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 1200 sq ft home. Coming from Spectrum where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.

Installation was supposed to happen two weeks ago. Technician never showed, never called. Rescheduled for 5 days later, tech arrived 2 hours late. Install took 4 hours and left cables running across my ceiling in the ugliest way possible. Asked about running them through walls, was told that costs extra. The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 2500 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $122. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 18 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.
title: Regret Switching to Frontier

review_text: Switched to Frontier Fiber 18 months ago and very happy with the decision. Previous provider (Spectrum) was unreliable with constant outages. Frontier has been solid - maybe one brief outage in 17 months. Speed tests consistently show 190 Mbps on my 500 Mbps plan which is great. Work from home daily with video calls and large file transfers, no issues at all. Price is $71/month which is reasonable for the speed. Installation was professional and on time. The tech explained everything and made sure I was satisfied before leaving. Customer service the one time I called was helpful and knowledgeable. Only minor complaint is the router could have better range, but it works fine for my needs. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for fiber internet.
Installation took 3 visits and service still doesn't work properly. Completely unprofessional.

title: Decent Service with Some Issues

review_text: Major issues with billing. Signed up at $37/month but actual bill is $480 after all the fees they don't tell you about upfront. Equipment rental (${equip}/mo), broadcast fee (${tv}/mo), regional sports fee (${sports}/mo) - I don't even have TV! Called to complain and they basically said tough luck, it's in the fine print. Customer service was rude and unhelpful. Service itself is okay when it works but I've had 3 outages in six weeks. Each time I call they promise a credit that never appears on my bill. The whole experience feels scammy. Contract ends in 3 months and I'll be switching immediately. Check all the fees before signing up or you'll get burned like I did.

After years of struggling with Cox's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 100 Mbps plan for $84/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $104 I was paying Cox for only 50 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 6 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $84 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.
Speeds are nowhere near advertised. Paying for 1000 Mbps, getting maybe 480 Mbps. Total ripoff.

title: Price Doubled After Promo

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $108 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $314 for service at an address I haven't lived at since May! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 1800 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $106. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 8 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.

title: Constant Outages and Poor Support

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 11 months ago after their sales rep promised me 200 Mbps fiber for just $37/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $126/month - over a 89% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $11/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $19/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $14/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $18 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 89 Mbps on average instead of the promised 200 Mbps. That's only 43% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 15 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 9 times over the past 5 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $237 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.
title: Cancellation Process is Impossible

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service.. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $99 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $246 for service at an address I haven't lived at since June! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: Billed for Service I Don't Have

review_text: After years of struggling with Xfinity's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 100 Mbps plan for $65/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $129 I was paying Xfinity for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 7 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 100 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $65 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Xfinity's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $81 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $286 for service at an address I haven't lived at since March! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

title: Fiber Changed Everything

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 9 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $47/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped 2 $116/month - over a 100% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $10/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $23/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $14/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $14 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 81 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 69% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 42 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 8 times over the past 7 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $216 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

title: Okay Overall

review_text: After years of struggling with Spectrum's unreliable cable internet here in Los Angeles, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 1000 Mbps plan for $85/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $127 I was paying Spectrum for only 50 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 4 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 1000 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $85 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Spectrum's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 18 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. title: Exceeded Expectations

review_text: After years of struggling with Comcast's unreliable cable internet here in Austin, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $50/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $132 I was paying Comcast for only 100 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 13 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $50 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Comcast's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

This makes working from home nearly impossible during peak hours. Customer service is terrible - I've called 6 times about the speed issues and each time they run diagnostics, say everything looks fine, and nothing changes. The last technician admitted the area is oversold but said there's nothing they can do. On top of that, my promotional rate ended and the bill jumped from $46 to $103 per month with no warning. Trying to negotiate got me nowhere. Really disappointed and actively looking at other providers. Would not recommend Frontier.
Speeds are nowhere near advertised. Paying for 500 Mbps, getting maybe 920 Mbps. Total ripoff.
title: Price Doubled After Promo

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 11 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $47/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $100/month - over a 82% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $13/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $16/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $14/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $17 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 36 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 67% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 36 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 4 times over the past 4 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $278 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.

The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 80 Mbps on average instead of the promised 1000 Mbps. That's only 47% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 25 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 4 times over the past 2 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $264 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.
title: Save Your Money - Go Elsewhere

review_text: I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $108 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $249 for service at an address I haven't lived at since July! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

After years of struggling with Cox's unreliable cable internet here in Houston, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $51/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $135 I was paying Cox for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 6 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $51 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.

review_text: Major issues with billing. Signed up at $32/month but actual bill is $190 after all the fees they don't tell you about upfront. Equipment rental (${equip}/mo), broadcast fee (${tv}/mo), regional sports fee (${sports}/mo) - I don't even have TV! Called to complain and they basically said tough luck, it's in the fine print. Customer service was rude and unhelpful. Service itself is okay when it works but I've had 6 outages in two months. Each time I call they promise a credit that never appears on my bill. The whole experience feels scammy. Contract ends in 7 months and I'll be switching immediately. Check all the fees before signing up or you'll get burned like I did.
title: Cannot Recommend

review_text: Where do I even begin with this nightmare experience? I signed up for Frontier 11 months ago after their sales rep promised me 500 Mbps fiber for just $52/month with 'no hidden fees.' That lasted exactly 12 months before my bill jumped to $105/month - over a 120% increase! When I called to ask why, they said the promotional period ended, which fine, I understand promos end. But the bill is itemized with all these fees that were never disclosed: $10/month equipment rental even though they said the router was 'included free,' $18/month broadcast TV surcharge for INTERNET ONLY service, $13/month regional sports fee (again, no TV service), and $17 in various mystery charges. The actual internet service itself is mediocre at best. Speed tests show I'm getting 71 Mbps on average instead of the promised 500 Mbps. That's only 37% of what I'm paying for. During evening hours it's even worse, dropping to 30 Mbps making streaming nearly impossible. I work from home and the connection drops randomly throughout the day - I've lost count of how many times I've been kicked out of important video meetings. Customer service is absolutely useless. I've called 8 times over the past 7 weeks trying to get help. Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $374 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.
title: Still Waiting for Resolution

review_text: Installation took 3 visits & service still doesn't work properly. Completely unprofessional.
title: Terrible Service

review_text: Installation was supposed to happen two weeks ago. Technician never showed, never called. Rescheduled for 5 days later, tech arrived 5 hours late. Install took 4 hours and left cables running across my ceiling in the ugliest way possible. Asked about running them through walls, was told that costs extra. The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 1200 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $110. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 10 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.

title: 5 Stars - Would Recommend

review_text: Installation was quick and professional. Service has been rock solid. Best ISP I've had.

Switched to Frontier Fiber 6 months ago and very happy with the decision. Previous provider (Comcast) was unreliable with constant outages. Frontier has been solid - maybe one brief outage in 17 months. Speed tests consistently show 190 Mbps on my 500 Mbps plan which is great. Work from home daily with video calls and large file transfers, no issues at all. Price is $84/month which is reasonable for the speed. Installation was professional and on time. The tech explained everything and made sure I was satisfied before leaving. Customer service the one time I called was helpful and knowledgeable. Only minor complaint is the router could have better range, but it works fine for my needs. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for fiber internet.

Switched to Frontier Fiber 10 months ago and very happy with the decision. Previous provider (Cox) was unreliable with constant outages. Frontier has been solid - maybe one brief outage in 11 months. Speed tests consistently show 480 Mbps on my 1000 Mbps plan which is great. Work from home daily with video calls and large file transfers, no issues at all. Price is $66/month which is reasonable for the speed. Installation was professional and on time. The tech explained everything and made sure I was satisfied before leaving. Customer service the one time I called was helpful and knowledgeable. Only minor complaint is the router could have better range, but it works fine for my needs. Overall very satisfied and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for fiber internet.

I am beyond frustrated with Frontier's customer service. Three months ago I called to cancel my service because I was relocating to another state for work. I followed their cancellation process exactly as instructed - called their number, spoke to a retention specialist who tried to keep me as a customer, I declined, got a confirmation number for the cancellation, and returned their equipment to an authorized UPS location with a receipt. Everything by the book. Yet here I am THREE MONTHS LATER still being charged $65 every single month on my credit card! The first month I thought maybe it was just a billing cycle thing and they'd credit it next month. When the second charge hit, I called immediately. Spent over an hour on the phone getting transferred between departments. One rep said my account showed as cancelled, another said it was still active, a third claimed there was a 'pending disconnection order' that hadn't been processed. No one could give me a straight answer. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told someone would call me back within 24-48 hours. That was three weeks ago - no callback. Third charge hits and I'm absolutely livid. I call again, demand to speak to billing supervisor, get told the same thing about a callback that never comes. Meanwhile I'm out $281 for service at an address I haven't lived at since April! I've initiated chargebacks with my credit card company and filed complaints with the Better Business Bureau and my state's Attorney General office. Now Frontier has the audacity to send my account to collections for 'unpaid balances' - balances I DO NOT OWE because I cancelled properly! This is affecting my credit score. I've kept meticulous records of every call, every confirmation number, the equipment return receipt, everything. This company is either completely incompetent or deliberately defrauding customers. Either way it should be illegal. If you ever plan to cancel Frontier, be prepared to fight them for months to stop fraudulent charges. Absolutely criminal behavior from this company.

Each time I spend 45+ minutes on hold, get transferred multiple times, explain the whole situation again to each person, and nothing ever gets resolved. Last tech who visited said the local infrastructure is 'at capacity' and there's nothing they can do about speed issues. So why do they keep selling service in oversold areas? The early termination fee is $205 which feels like being held hostage. I'm seriously considering paying it just to escape. Do NOT trust Frontier's advertising. The promotional price is fake, the speeds are fake, and support is nonexistent. Going to file complaints with FCC and BBB. You've been warned.
title: Still Waiting for Resolution

review_text: Installation was supposed to happen Monday. Technician never showed, never called. Rescheduled for the next week, tech arrived 5 hours late. Install took 5 hours and left cables running across my ceiling in the ugliest way possible. Asked about running them through walls, was told that costs extra. The router they provided is garbage - WiFi barely reaches my bedroom in a 1800 sq ft apartment. Had to buy my own router for $196. Service works okay but not worth the hassle. Support is slow to respond and unhelpful. Been with them 8 months and counting down until contract ends. Installation quality was unprofessional and the equipment is subpar. Would give zero stars if I could.
title: Support Refuses to Help

title: Billing Nightmare

review_text: Had Frontier for 6 months in Dallas and it's been excellent. The 500 Mbps fiber plan is perfect for our household - two people working from home plus kids streaming and gaming. Speeds are consistent throughout the day even during peak hours. Bill has stayed at $53/month as quoted, no surprise increases or hidden fees which is refreshing. Had one service issue early on and support resolved it quickly with a tech visit the next day. Installation was smooth, tech was professional and cleaned up after himself. The included router has good WiFi coverage for our 1800 sq ft home. Coming from Xfinity where service was spotty and support was awful, this has been a huge upgrade. Highly recommend Frontier if fiber is available in your area.

title: Cancellation Process is Impossible

review_text: After years of struggling with Cox's unreliable cable internet here in Dallas, switching to Frontier Fiber has been absolutely life-changing for our household. Let me explain why this has been such a great experience from start to finish. The initial sales process was refreshingly straightforward - no high-pressure tactics, just clear information about what speeds were available at my address and honest pricing. I went with their 200 Mbps plan for $50/month which seemed almost too good compared to the $99 I was paying Cox for only 200 Mbps. Installation was scheduled within a week and the techs showed up right on time in the promised window. They were professional, explained everything they were doing, and took care to run the fiber line neatly without damaging my landscaping. The whole setup took about two hours and they tested everything thoroughly before leaving, even helping me connect my smart home devices and optimize WiFi placement. Now for the actual service - it's been 11 months and I honestly cannot remember the last time we had any issues. Speed tests consistently show I'm getting the full 200 Mbps I'm paying for, sometimes even slightly higher. This is actual fiber directly to the home, not the 'fiber to the neighborhood' fake fiber some ISPs advertise. The upstream is symmetrical too which is amazing for cloud backups and video uploads. I work entirely from home doing software development which means I'm on VPNs and video calls all day. My spouse also works remotely in graphic design uploading huge files. We have two teenagers who are constantly streaming, gaming online, and video chatting with friends. Plus all our IoT devices, smart TVs, tablets, etc. We regularly have 15-20 devices connected simultaneously and have never experienced any slowdown or congestion even during peak evening hours. Gaming latency is consistently under 15ms which my son says is excellent for competitive play. The reliability has been perfect - I think we've had exactly one outage in all this time and it was during a major thunderstorm that knocked out power to half the neighborhood. Service was restored within an hour of power coming back. The billing has been exactly as promised too - $50 per month, no hidden fees, no surprise increases, no equipment rental charges because the router is included. After dealing with Cox's bait-and-switch pricing tactics for years this transparency is so refreshing. The customer service the couple times I've needed to contact them has been responsive and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Frontier Fiber to anyone who has it available in their area. Best internet service I've had in my 20+ years as a consumer. Worth every penny.
Great internet! Fast speeds, reliable service. Had Frontier for 8 months now with no issues. Highly recommend.
Speeds are nowhere near advertised. Paying for 500 Mbps, getting maybe 190 Mbps. Total ripoff.
title: Regret Switching to Frontier
